page.title: 10Dun Cow Hotel,near Rugby
page.content: The Dun Cow Hotel is a 17th century building with 20 bedrooms.It has a 3 star A.A. rating.An average of 6205 people stay there each year.The costs of bedrooms are-single Â£35 per night, double Â£46 per night for bed & break- fast.There is a restaurant for evening meals & lunches.This service is also available for non-residants.The Dun Cow can also be hired for wedding receptions,birthday parties etc. There is a legend about why the Dun Cow Inn was so called.The Dun Cow was apparently a monstrous beast 4 metres high and 6 metres long,which is said to have given milk to the surrounding villages until a witch milked it with a sieve.It then went mad and after causing havoc,was finally killed by Guy of Warwick on Dunsmore Heath.
